inclusion.criterion: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 (HER2) negative breast cancer
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: No evidence of metastatic disease on CT, bone scan or other imaging
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Fit for consideration of chemotherapy as determined by the Investigator
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: candidate for tumor resection and agrees to do so prior to chemotherapy

inclusion.criterion: Adequate performance status (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) 0 or 1
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Adequate surgical excision of breast tumour (mastectomy or lumpectomy) and lymph nodes
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: axillary sampling revealed 5 positive lymph nodes

inclusion.criterion: Involvement of 1-3 lymph nodes (N1, including micrometastases)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: axillary sampling revealed 5 positive lymph nodes

inclusion.criterion: Candidates for preoperative therapy for early breast cancer
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: candidate for tumor resection and agrees to do so prior to chemotherapy

inclusion.criterion: Involvement of at least one lymph node, (including micrometastases) on biopsy
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: axillary sampling revealed 5 positive lymph nodes

inclusion.criterion: Adequate tissue from core biopsy for 21 gene RS testing (approximate minimum 5mm)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: HER2 positive tumours as defined by IHC 3+ or FISH ≥ 2.0
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Node negative disease, including those with Isolated tumour cells only (node negative i+/i-)
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: axillary sampling revealed 5 positive lymph nodes

exclusion.criterion: Patients not considered by their treating physician to be fit to undergo chemotherapy.
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: candidate for tumor resection and agrees to do so prior to chemotherapy

notes: 45-year-old postmenopausal woman with cytologically confirmed breast cancer. A core biopsy revealed a 3 cm invasive ductal breast carcinoma in the left upper outer quadrant.
